% Mineral-specific absorption coefficient in the range 380 to 2280 nm 
% Wavelength and mineral-specific absorption coefficient
% Martin Hieronymi, HZG, 2015
% Data based on the Hydrolight astarmin_average.txt
% These values are the average of the calcareous sand, red clay, yellow clay, and brown earth spectra
% Adapted to measurements of Roettgers et al. from North Sea and Baltic Sea
% Extrapolated to 2280 nm
% Wavelength Absorption
% wl   	 a_m_star
% [nm] 	 [m^2/g] 
380.0  	 0.1023600
382.5  	 0.1007350
385.0  	 0.0991100
387.5  	 0.0973150
